sections.heading: off another's livestock; penalty
sections.text: Any cattle drover, or his employee, who shall drive off any neat cattle, horses, mules, or sheep belonging to another person, intentionally or through neglect, shall be guilty of a Class V misdemeanor.SourceLaws 1879, § 2, p. 67;R.S.1913, § 97;C.S.1922, § 105;C.S.192

54-302.Driving off another's livestock; penalty.

Any cattle drover, or his employee, who shall drive off any neat cattle, horses, mules, or sheep belonging to another person, intentionally or through neglect, shall be guilty of a Class V misdemeanor.

SourceLaws 1879, § 2, p. 67;R.S.1913, § 97;C.S.1922, § 105;C.S.1929, § 54-302;R.S.1943, § 54-302;Laws 1977, LB 39, § 17.
